alert.note: Alert for Santa Barbara (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued December 30 at 7:01AM PST by NWS Oxnard
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 AM PST THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of southwest California, including the following county, Eastern Santa Barbara. * WHEN...Until 800 AM PST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 656 AM PST, heavier rains have ended, though areas of light to moderate rain continue moving across the advisory area. This will support the continued potential for minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Santa Barbara, Montecito, Carpinteria, Summerland, Goleta, Big Pine Mountain, Mission Canyon, Highway 154 over San Marcos Pass, Hope Ranch and Old Man Mountain. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
